com.sri.ai.grinder.polynomial.core

Class DefaultMonomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.AbstractExpression
      • com.sri.ai.expresso.helper.AbstractExpressionWrapper
        • com.sri.ai.grinder.polynomial.core.DefaultMonomial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression, Monomial, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>

    @Beta
public class DefaultMonomial
extends AbstractExpressionWrapper
implements Monomial
    Default implementation of the Monomial interface.
    Author:
    oreilly
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Monomial times(Monomial multiplier)
      Multiply this Monomial by another.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Overridden in order to avoid using Expression's implementation, which would use the cached inner expression and not produce an update String if the instance changed (remember that instances to this class are allowed to change before being used as an expression for the first time).

      • make

        public static Monomial make(Expression expression)

      • getNumericFactor

        public com.sri.ai.util.math.Rational getNumericFactor()
        Specified by:
        getNumericFactor in interface Monomial
        Returns:
        the numeric factor of the monomial (if not explicitly defined is 1).

      • getFactors

        public java.util.Set<Expression> getFactors()
        Description copied from interface: Monomial
        The factors of a monomial M is the Collection factors(M). They are the expressions being multiplied, and possibly exponentiated by non-negative integers. Example: 
         
 factors(10 * |Dogs|^2 * |People|^3 * f(y) * (x + 2) * x^2) = { 10, |Dogs|, |People|, f(y), x + 2, x }
        Specified by:
        getFactors in interface Monomial
        Returns:
        a Set representation of the factors contained within the Monomial (this includes the numeric factor).

      • getOrderedNonNumericFactors

        public java.util.List<Expression> getOrderedNonNumericFactors()
        Description copied from interface: Monomial
        Get a unique list, ordered, of the non-numeric factors in the monomial.
        Specified by:
        getOrderedNonNumericFactors in interface Monomial
        Returns:
        an ordered list of the non-numeric factors contained in the monomial.

      • getPowersOfNonNumericFactors

        public java.util.List<com.sri.ai.util.math.Rational> getPowersOfNonNumericFactors()
        Specified by:
        getPowersOfNonNumericFactors in interface Monomial
        Returns:
        the powers of the non-numeric factors in the monomial, which map to the order of these factors.

      • getCoefficient

        public Monomial getCoefficient(java.util.List<Expression> factors)
        Description copied from interface: Monomial
        The coefficient of a monomial M wrt a set of factors F is the product of the remaining factors of M. Example: 
         
 coefficient(3*x^2*y^4, { x }) = 3* y^4
        Specified by:
        getCoefficient in interface Monomial
        Parameters:
        factors - what are to be considered the factors of the monomial (i.e. not part of the coefficient).
        Returns:
        the product of the remaining factors in this monomial not in the given list of factors.

      • getPowerOfFactor

        public com.sri.ai.util.math.Rational getPowerOfFactor(Expression factor)
        Description copied from interface: Monomial
        Get the power of the given factor if it is a factor of the monomial otherwise return 0.
        Specified by:
        getPowerOfFactor in interface Monomial
        Parameters:
        factor - the factor whose power is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the power of the given factor if the factor is contained in the monomial. If not contained in the monomial will return 0.

      • degree

        public int degree()
        Description copied from interface: Monomial
        The degree of a monomial is the sum of the exponents of all its non-numeric factors (numeric factors have a degree of 0).
        Specified by:
        degree in interface Monomial
        Returns:
        the degree of the monomial.

      • divide

        public com.sri.ai.util.base.Pair<Monomial,Monomial> divide(Monomial divisor)
        Description copied from interface: Monomial
        Divide this monomial by another. 
         
 this.divide(that) = this/that
        Specified by:
        divide in interface Monomial
        Parameters:
        divisor - the divisor
        Returns:
        a pair consisting of the quotient and remainder of this/divisor.

      • exponentiate

        public Monomial exponentiate(int exponent)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Monomial
        Raise this monomial to a given power.
        Specified by:
        exponentiate in interface Monomial
        Parameters:
        exponent - a non negative integer exponent to raise the monomial to.
        Returns:
        a monomial which is the result of raising this monomial to the given exponent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the exponent is negative.

      • set

        public Expression set(int i,
                      Expression newIthArgument)
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        If this is a function application, returns an expression equal to this one, but for replacing the i-th argument by the given one. Generates an error otherwise.
        Specified by:
        set in interface Expression
        Overrides:
        set in class AbstractExpressionWrapper

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: AbstractExpressionWrapper
        Overridden in order to avoid using Expression's implementation, which would use the cached inner expression and not produce an update String if the instance changed (remember that instances to this class are allowed to change before being used as an expression for the first time). This implementation re-computes an Expression every time it is invoked.
        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractExpressionWrapper
